meanings.definition: The state or quality of being elderly.
meanings.sent1: Her elderlinesses showed in the way she moved slowly and carefully.
meanings.sent2: The elderlinesses of the residents in the nursing home were evident in their gray hair and wrinkled skin.
meanings.sent3: Despite her elderlinesses, Grandma still had a mischievous twinkle in her eye.
meanings.sent4: The elderlinesses of the ancient oak tree were reflected in its gnarled branches and thick trunk.
meanings.sent5: The village celebrated the elderlinesses of its oldest member with a special ceremony.

meanings.definition: The condition of being advanced in age.
meanings.sent1: The elderlinesses of the retired couple were evident in their leisurely walks around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: In the nursing home, the elderlinesses of the residents were respected and cared for by the staff.
meanings.sent3: Despite their elderlinesses, the elderly couple still enjoyed dancing together in the evenings.
meanings.sent4: The elderlinesses of the ancient ruins spoke of a time long past and forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The elderlinesses of the wise old owl were evident in its knowing gaze and hoots in the night.
